content.question:
“O tandem magnis pelagi defuncte periclis

(sed terrae graviora manent), in regna Lavini

Dardanidae venient (mitte hanc de pectore curam),

sed non et venisse volent. Bella, horrida bella,

(5) et Thybrim multo spumantem sanguine cerno.

Non Simois tibi nec Xanthus nec Dorica castra

defuerint; alius Latio iam partus Achilles,

natus et ipse dea; nec Teucris addita Iuno

usquam aberit, cum tu supplex in rebus egenis

(10) quas gentes Italum aut quas non oraveris urbes!

Causa mali tanti coniunx iterum hospita Teucris

externique iterum thalami.”

Aeneid 6. 83-94

In the passage above, the Sibyl is prophesying to Aeneas.In a short essay, discuss the effect on the reader created by the mixture of references to the past, present, and future. Refer specifically to the Latin throughout the passage to support the points you make in your essay.

(When you are asked to refer specifically to the Latin, you must write out the Latin AND you must translate, accurately paraphrase, or make clear in your discussion that you understand the Latin.)
